definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: Two special units focusing on initial and final consonant clusters.
sentences.chinese: 包含两个特别的单元，提供字首与字尾子音群的练习。

sentences.english: Omission of a final or initial sound in pronunciation.
You put the prefix before the rest of the word.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把字首放在字的其他部分之前。

sentences.english: If checked, introduce another directory hierarchy for the artists' initials.
sentences.chinese: 如果选中，将为艺人字首引入另一种目录分层结构。

sentences.english: These pages give some of the most common prefixes, though there are many more that are not listed here.
sentences.chinese: 这里列出最常见的字首，虽然还有很多没被列入。

sentences.english: Sometimes you think you are seeing one prefix when you see another.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你会以为看到某一个字首但其实是另一个。

sentences.english: A word might have no prefix at all, even though it looks like it has one.
sentences.chinese: 一个字也许完全没有字首，即使它看起来有。

sentences.english: The famous Chanel logo of two intertwined Cs is based on her initials.
sentences.chinese: 著名的香奈儿双C交叠商标即来自她的姓名字首。

definition: component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
original form of a Chinese character
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
single Chinese character/word (in a foreign language)
